Lindsay Kay

At BioDigital we scored a Webby and the SXSW Interactive Award for the BioDigital Human

Portfolio

Over the last few years, I've contracted remotely for clients in New Zealand, USA, Netherlands, France and Sweden. Here's a bunch of articles describing those projects, plus some open source frameworks I created to base them on.

Developing the SolidComponents™ Viewer on xeogl

SolidComponents™ is a market leader for high-end online CAD support.

March 24, 2018

Developing the BioDigital Human™ on SceneJS

SceneJS is an open source JavaScript library I created for WeGL-based 3D graphics.

In this article, I describe SceneJS' journey from a weekend experiment to how we ended up creating the world's leading Web-based anatomy visualization platform around it.

[ READ ARTICLE >> ]

March 23, 2018

Developing the BIMData IFC Viewer on xeogl

xeogl is an open source JavaScript library I created for WebGL-based 3D graphics.

In this article, I describe my recent work developing the BIMData 3D IFC viewer on xeogl.

[ UNDER CONSTRUCTION ]

March 22, 2018

Developing the BIMSurfer IFC Viewer on xeogl

xeogl is an open source JavaScript library I created for WebGL-based 3D graphics.

In this article, I describe my work rewriting the BIMSurfer 3D IFC viewer, to convert it from using SceneJS to xeogl.

[ READ ARTICLE >> ]

February 16, 2018

xeometry - a WebGL-based 3D model viewing library

xeometry is an experimental open source JavaScript library I created for viewing and interacting with 3D glTF models on WebGL.

Use xeometry to rapidly build 3D viewer apps and interactive presentations, or as a boilerplate on which to base your own 3D viewer.

[ VISIT WEBSITE >> ]

February 16, 2018

xeogl - a WebGL-based 3D visualization engine

xeogl is an open source (MIT) JavaScript library I created for 3D model visualization on WebGL, based on lessons learned from SceneJS.

[ VISIT WEBSITE >> ]

February 16, 2018

Testing Wind Turbines for Windflow™

In New Zealand, I worked with electrical and mechanical engineers to verify that WindowFlow Technology's 500kW turbines generated enough power without falling over or blowing up.

In this project, my job was to number-crunch terrabyte-sized datasets using procedural SQL and Java to analyse the turbines' power efficiency and structural performance.

[ UNDER CONSTRUCTION ]

March 19, 2017

Creating xeogl Demos for zSpace VR/AR

zSpace is a technology firm based in Sunnyvale, California that creates mixed reality systems that combine elements of virtual and augmented reality in a specially-built computer system. in 2017, zSpace loaned me one of their zSpace 300 systems so that I could write some WebGL-based demo applications using xeogl. This is a quick writeup of how that went.
